title: How can I create vertically uneven ray sensor

content.raw:
<[http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=guided\_i&tut=guided\_i1](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=guided_i&tut=guided_i1)>I am following this tutorial to create my 3D lidar. Also refer to \[velodyne\_simulator\]\([[https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne\_simulator/src/master/](https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/master/)](https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/master)\)

But their rays are all uniformly distribute between min\_angle and max\_angle in the vertical direction. I want my rays to be uneven like 0°, 5°, 8°, 10°,……How can I do that? Thanks
content.html:
<http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?cat=guided_i&tut=guided_i1>I am following this tutorial to create my 3D lidar. Also refer to [velodyne_simulator]([https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/master/](https://bitbucket.org/DataspeedInc/velodyne_simulator/src/master/))

But their rays are all uniformly distribute between min_angle and max_angle in the vertical direction. I want my rays to be uneven like 0°, 5°, 8°, 10°,……How can I do that? Thanks
